isis.stitle: FRONT DRIVE AXLE WHEEL ENDS: FABCO SDA-12 - DISASSEMBLY - REMOVAL OF OUTBOARD SECTION OF THE STEERABLE DRIVE END ASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: REMOVAL OF OUTBOARD SECTION OF THE STEERABLE DRIVE END ASSEMBLY
svcproc.para: This procedure has been established for removal of the Outboard Section as an Assembly.

note.para: After following this procedure, the outboard section of the end may be disassembled at the bench.

step1.para: Perform Items 1 and 2 of Hub, Drum and Wheel Bearing Disassembly.
Rotate the brake drum to position the outer drive yoke horizontally.
Unbolt the universal joint cross and bearing from the outer drive yoke ( Figure 21).

Disconnect the tie rod by removing the cotter pin, castle nut and then, while prying between the tie rod end and the tie rod arm, sharply strike the side of the tie rod arm radially to the tie rod end tapered stud.
Attach the outboard section of the steerable drive end to a transmission jack that is equipped to handle the assembly (refer to Figure 24).

figure.caption: Figure 24. Transmission Jack with Fixture for Handling Drive End Assembly

step1.para: Remove the four bolts that hold the upper kingpin bracket to the spindle yoke.
Lower the transmission jack about two inches and roll the outer section of the steerable drive end away from the axle (refer to Figure 25).
